page.title: 09Tourism in the Thornton Area
page.content: Thornton Dale is on the border of the {North York Moors,}which makes it a popular place for many tourists.There are many famous and historical places to visit: The Thatched Cottage,The Stone Crosses on the Moors and the beautiful scenery.Thornton has long been called the prettiest village in Yorkshire.{The Thatched Cottage}is one of the most photographed buildings of Thornton.It stands on the bank of the beck. With a small beck running through the centre of the village, visitors enjoy the chance to feed the ducks. Another great attraction is the village stocks, although the original ones have now been replaced. People stay in many holiday cottages. At present, most tourists come in August. {Cycling}holidays are popular, particularly with men.
